data.title: Great little coffeehouse!
data.text: It was packed in there when I stopped in around 10:30am on a Friday morning. Great, very friendly service and some unique and delicious items on their menu. I had a lavender latte and a pumpkin and sweet potato tart thing that was SO good!

data.title: Old-school chic
data.text: This everything I want in a coffee house; comforting and welcoming atmosphere, friendly staff, and of course top notch coffee. I wish I could have hung out here all day.  I'll definitely be back.

data.title: Great little coffeehouse!
data.text: We were walking around downtown Plano and decided to stop in for drinks and desserts. Everything was tasty, and I loved the decor and atmosphere. It's not as small and cramped as some coffee shops, and there was a lot of varied seating options. If I lived closer, I'd be a regular customer.

data.title: Great coffee in a cool setting
data.text: The shop is in a downtown area of Plano. On a weekend morning, there was plenty of parking on the street. The coffee was very good, and the atmosphere is an eclectic collection of couches, chairs, and tables. Yet, everything flows together with earthy colors. The place is very comfortable, and the Wifi is strong.

data.title: Throwback with a Texas Twist
data.text:
When you open the door, you immediately realize that you're in an independent coffee shop. The aroma of fresh coffee permeates the establishment. Comfortable couches, chairs, and works areas abound. The rough hewn brick wall on one side and stress wood on the other give it a homey feel. It was quiet enough to conduct a conversation but loud enough that you didn't feel that you were bothering others.
The coffee was served quickly and politely.
I'll definitely return.

data.title: Relaxed-Cozy-Quaint Place Very Enjoyable Coffee Shop
data.text:
I've been to this coffee shop twice now, and I love it.  The location in old downtown Plano creates a nice atmosphere for the coffee shop.  The brick side walk, awning and bistro tables outside are nice.  Inside, the eclectic array of art, chairs, window frames, bikes, burlap sacks and a dozen other unique items create a very cozy feeling.  The blue tiled ceiling is a great look that sends you back in time.

The servers were very interactive and happy.  They engaged nicely with new people as well as regulars they know by name.  Routine laps were made around the shop to pick up empty drinks and clear off tables and chairs.  I really appreciated that.

The drinks were great.  It's the regular compliment of drinks you would expect in a coffee shop.  They have a few breakfast items like Kolaches, Stuffed Croissants and rolls.  A sign near the checkout counter lists a handful of sandwiches available for sale.

We spent about four hours here reading, working, talking and drinking coffee.  It was very relaxed.  The music is down low.  You can hear it, but it does not disturb you while working.  People talked but it was in low tones.  Really nice place!

data.title: Great little gem!
data.text: Great place for coffee with friends and family. There was a line but service was fast. The latte was made perfectly. We tried the cinnamon bun and banana cupcake.  Very good quality pastries. They were both delicious! We will be coming back real soon.

data.title: Low-key, quiet and great coffee!
data.text: I like this coffee shop. A friend of mine who works in walking distance told me about it and one day, finding I needed to get some work done away from my office, I took my laptop and headed out to Fourteen Eighteen Coffeehouse. I found the coffee to be the best I've had at any coffee shop in recent memory. I ate some kind of pastry, but the coffee stood out the most - it was outstanding. If you're looking for a quiet place to sit and read, reflect, or get a little work done outside your normal environ, then this is your spot. Great atmosphere, nice personnel, outstanding coffee. Just a head's up - parking is tight downtown.

data.title: Best coffee in Plano
data.text: Whenever I visit Plano, Fourteen Eighteen Coffeehouse is the place I go. The ambience is given to conversation and sipping a wonderful brew. My daughter and I have a coffee date inside or street-side.

data.title: No better place for coffee and conversation!!!
data.text:
First off, it's cozy. It's the kind of place you'd own, if you had a coffee shop. It's the kind of place you find and go...FINALLY. The coffee is fantastic, so many options to choose, from standard, to mocha with almond milk, to a pour over. I had the breakfast burrito once...don't do that! But even a disappointing burrito can keep me from giving this place high marks! I know once the word gets out, I won't find a place to sit. But everyone should have a chance to curl up on a couch here and feel peaceful and happy like a well-fed kitten basking in the sun midday.

I suggest a mocha, with a slice of the Smooth Operator Emporium Pie! Heaven. My daughter likes the (pour in hot water into a) container of oatmeal, with some almond milk. You will leave there having made new friends, or you can put on your headphones and chill to some music. Either way, you'll leave with a smile on your face.

data.title: Depends on what you're looking for
data.text:
The good: location (downtown historic Plano), really cool atmosphere, cozy seating, dimmed lighting, sort of warm industrial feel, knowledgeable staff

The not-for-me: flavor in latte was overwhelming (but that's subjective I guess), kind of pricey, seems like mostly a hangout for college kids + kind of crowded (but maybe those were just because of the time of day)

I might go back if I were in the area, but I wouldn't make a special trip to go again. Not a bad coffeehouse, just not my favorite. Just depends what you're looking for!

data.title: Warm and Cozy Place for Coffee
data.text: Very nice atmoshphere and perfect for enjoying coffee.  There is some outdoor seating, but a perfect place on a chilly day!  They do serve some food as well.

data.title: Brilliant Cappuccino
data.text:
Wonderful coffee house vibe 
Amazing cappuccino 
Fantastic and friendly customer service 
Good for visiting, socializing, studying, working, or hanging out!

data.title: Great coffeehouse
data.text: Absolutely love this coffeehouse in the heart of Downtown Plano.  It does seem to stay pretty busy so not always a guarantee that you will have a place to sit if you plan on staying a while.

data.title: Tea is excellent too!
data.text: I'm not a coffee drinker, so I ordered passion fruit tea. The tea was wonderful! Fourteen Eighteen Coffeehouse is a great place to meet for a small meeting of two to four people.

data.title: Excellent coffee, even better atmosphere
data.text:
Any kind of coffee you'd like, they can do it.  we love to frequent locally owned businesses and this one is worth any drive if you want a great spot to sit and enjoy a coffee or tea and actually have a conversation too.  Downtown Plano is a great spot to sit and people watch and window shop.  The extra bonus is that they also offer gluten free muffins and other treats and serve several yummy looking lunch options too.  
Highly recommend this great coffee shop!

data.title: Awesome find! WAY better than Starbucks
data.text:
This fun, eclectic little shop is the best thing that has happened to my coffee drinking since I discovered skinny lattes!  Nestled in among other fun and unique shops in historic downtown Plano, this little haven is my new favorite spot to meet friends, relax on a lazy Saturday, or just to get a little caffeine boost.

The atmosphere is fun and inviting.  A large array of couches and wing back and barrel chairs are separated with fun tables and lamps.  Each grouping is different from the last, offering many options for comfortable seating.  Old window frames hung from the rafters serve both as decor and a divider of sorts in the seating areas.  The walls of the century old space boast old brick peeking out from beneath worn plaster, giving the space that "old downtown" feel.  The original tin ceiling is visible, painted a comforting shade of blue.  Simply charming.

The coffee offerings are both standard and unique.  Latte your thing? You'll find a great one here with many flavoring choices.  Love trying something new?  This is the place!  Last month the "purple haze" was a delicious drink, infusing lavender into a latte.  The chai latte is exceptional, and the house brew is great. The Christmas Cookie latte is a wonderful holiday concoction that really did make the season bright. The "slow bar" has multiple types of pour over coffee and a french press. Everything we've tried has been delightful.  Before checking out, don't miss the display of tasty treats ranging from a delicious breakfast burrito to the amazing cranberry scone, tasty muffins and other yummy items.

The owner/manager is a former nurse who is married to a pastor.  I love that Fourteen Eighteen shares coffee grounds with gardeners.  They're green thinkers.  They also provide free WiFi for those times when surfing the web over a cup o' joe is the chosen activity of the day.

Don't miss this gem.  But get in line behind me, please.

data.title: Best coffee in plano
data.text: You won't be disappointed.   True barristas using Oak Cliff coffee and Braum's milk.   Great atmosphere too.

data.title: Homey, quaint, comfortable, nice music, clean & overstuffed chairs.
data.text:
If you live in Plano, this might do as your "Go To" place for coffee, quiet talks and computing. 
I went in to just kill some time waiting for my daughter and found a peaceful haven. I intend to return asap to just mellow with a cuppa. I really like coffee.
If you are looking for NON-frantic, you just found it.
I went in on a whim and pulled out my wallet to get $2 for a small coffee of the day and the lady taking my order asked if I was a veteran. I said "yes" and she told me my coffee was free in honor of Veteran's Day. She also thanked me for my service.
I did not eat anything since I was going to dinner with my daughter. I did not notice if they served booze.

data.title: Love the atmosphere
data.text: The atmosphere and decor in the coffeehouse is awesome. It is so relaxing and peaceful. It is the ideal place to get coffee and relax. It's great for studying and just sitting out in some comfy furniture with an awesome drink. It's the same price as coffee elsewhere, but a mom & pop kind of thing. It's good, but the atmosphere is what I enjoyed most.
